title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady was close to joining the Raiders in 2020, but the team chose a different direction.
Brady, who retired in 2023, now owns a 10% stake in the Las Vegas Raiders.
The NFL amended rules allowing Brady, a FOX commentator, to attend production meetings but not team facilities.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is streaming on HBO Max.
'Highest 2 Lowest' by Spike Lee featuring Denzel Washington is available on Apple TV+.
'The Great British Baking Show' season 16 is now streaming on Netflix.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll will face the Patriots in Foxborough, as both have switched to the Raiders.
New England's Mike Vrabel and Las Vegas's Pete Carroll praise the strong, physical Patriots' offensive and defensive lines.
Jakobi Meyers shares excitement about playing against his former team but remains uncertain about his future trade status.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTube streamer IShowSpeed live-streamed their tour of Boston, including a visit to a Boston Tea Party Ship.
The Celtics star humorously reenacted the Boston Tea Party by shooting buckets of tea into water, commenting on high taxes.
Brown challenged IShowSpeed to a race in Downtown Crossing, where IShowSpeed claimed victory despite an alleged hamstring injury.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, Patriots' 2025 No. 4 pick, will debut as starting left tackle against Raiders, pending ankle recovery.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's motor and dynamic run blocking, despite concerns about his arm length for pass protection.
Campbell received high ratings in preseason, earning over 80 in both pass and run blocking from Pro Football Focus.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel responded to Bill Belichick's ban on Patriots scouts at UNC, saying it's their choice and they'll adapt.
Bill Belichick, now coaching at UNC, prohibits Patriots scouts from practices due to strained relations with Robert Kraft.
Despite the ban, Patriots scouts can request film and information on UNC players but must observe from afar.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Jane Doe, a University of Rhode Island student, is suing URI for alleged filming in her dorm's unisex shower.
The lawsuit claims the university was negligent and defamed her after she reported the incident last spring.
The man responsible, James Paquette, faces a state-level charge of video voyeurism, according to the lawsuit.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss Sunday's season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Patriots' rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for the game with an ankle injury.
Raiders feature new coach Pete Carroll and QB Geno Smith for their game against the Patriots.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's recovery from an Achilles injury is progressing well, according to Celtics teammate Jordan Walsh.
No specific timeline has been set for Tatum's return, but he is making significant strides post-surgery.
Celtics' roster changes offer opportunities for young players during Tatum's recovery period this season.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders hired Pete Carroll as head coach and reunited him with quarterback Geno Smith for a new era.
Tom Brady, a minority owner of the Raiders, is not attending Sunday's game due to his Fox Sports duties.
Rookie running back Ashton Jeanty is favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year after an impressive college career.
